title: polio-nanopore/piranha
description: Polio investigation resource automating nanopore haplotype analysis.

input_options.title: Input Options
input_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

barcodes_csv.title: Barcodes
barcodes_csv.description: A CSV file with barcode and sample columns.

run_dir.title: Run directory
run_dir.description: A directory containing a directory of fastq for a each barcode in a run.
run_dir.help_text: A directory containing subdirectories of fastq files as created by MinKNOW.

output_options.title: Output Options
output_options.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

out_dir.title: Output folder name
out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

analysis_options.title: Analysis Options
analysis_options.description: Define the thresholds for filtering and assembly.

config.description: A config file with parameters for piranha.

min_read_depth.title: Minimum read depth required for consensus generation

min_read_pcent.title: Minimum percentage of sample required for consensus generation

primer_length.title: Length of primer sequences to trim off start and end of reads

phylo_options.title: Phylogenetic Options
phylo_options.description: Options for running the phylogenetics module.

supplementary_datadir.title: Supplementary data
supplementary_datadir.description: Path to directory containing supplementary sequence FASTA file and optional metadata to be incorporated into phylogenetic analysis.

miscellaneous_options.title: Miscellaneous Options
miscellaneous_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.
